channel.title: Brits crackdown on Piracy
channel.description:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wVMzj0n_mJ8&feature=sub
The UK government has officially announced its controversial Digital Economy Bill to cover illegal file sharing, videogame classification and radio broadcasting. Kevin Pereira finds out how this legal framework could affect consumers here in the States.
So yeah, if TL;DL then, basically, 3 strikes = problem.

item.title: Brits crackdown on Piracy
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

SETO:

i guess Canadians (such as me) are safe, for now. cause downloading copyrighted materials is legal here but not uploading.

This is true for music downloads

cb-cda.gc.ca

2003-2004-e.pdf

615.87 KB

Read full topic

item.title: Brits crackdown on Piracy
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:35, topic:316101”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=412677.msg3053814#msg3053814 date=1260298835]
Not at all, as far as they’re concerned, I’m uploading as fast as I’m downloading.
[/quote]

Huh? Surely faking your ratio only changed what’s reported to the tracker? It’s not the tracker who bottlenecks your download rate afaik[/quote]
it reports differnt speeds to the actual speeds thereby changing the ratio, some people go over the top a mod of a tracker posted a screenshot of a banned user who had uploaded about 8PB

Read full topic

Not at all, as far as they’re concerned, I’m uploading as fast as I’m downloading.

Huh? Surely faking your ratio only changed what’s reported to the tracker? It’s not the tracker who bottlenecks your download rate afaik

item.title: Brits crackdown on Piracy
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:33, topic:316101”][quote author=inertia link=topic=412677.msg3053783#msg3053783 date=1260296177]

Or fake the usage being submitted It’s been done. I do it.

then you’re a shitbag who should be hunted down and gutted

Good job not over-reacting or anything Mopman.

But seriously, it is a douche-bag thing to do.

His punishment is painfully slow download speed, it’s all good.
[/quote]

Not at all, as far as they’re concerned, I’m uploading as fast as I’m downloading.[/quote]
whats the point in doing that though, if you get caught you will get named and shamed across a lot of trackers, news travels fast

Read full topic

item.title: Brits crackdown on Piracy
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:25, topic:316101”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=412677.msg3053478#msg3053478 date=1260256350]
if you cap your upload speed to 0.1kb/s you will effectively upload nothing and will in most cases upload nothing as other potential peers’ clients will get it from elsewhere instead of you because there wont be enough speed for you to make a difference
[/quote]

and your download rate will be terrible and you’ll get banned from the tracker for leeching

face it, if you can’t upload, bittorrent is not for you.[/quote]
this is true, however some trackers wont ban you if you’re a VIP or if you’re a good strong community member however usenet would be a better option if you’re not planning on uploading

Read full topic

item.title: Brits crackdown on Piracy
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

But from a legal standpoint, even uploading at 0.1kb/s is still uploading. Torrent clients will not allow you to download without uploading at all, with the exception of the rare case when you are the only one downloading.

Read full topic

item.title: Brits crackdown on Piracy
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

item.title: Brits crackdown on Piracy
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

sanga282:

if you cap your upload speed to 0.1kb/s you will effectively upload nothing and will in most cases upload nothing as other potential peers’ clients will get it from elsewhere instead of you because there wont be enough speed for you to make a difference

and your download rate will be terrible and you’ll get banned from the tracker for leeching

face it, if you can’t upload, bittorrent is not for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Brits crackdown on Piracy
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:23, topic:316101”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=412677.msg3052836#msg3052836 date=1260217462]

i guess Canadians (such as me) are safe, for now. cause downloading copyrighted materials is legal here but not uploading.

So torrents are illegal, doesn’t sound that safe to me.

Apparently only if you seed them.
[/quote]

You cannot download a torrent without also uploading.[/quote]
this is effectively true as its in the nature of a bittorrent client to share and trade data instead of just grabbing it, however if you the only peer you wont upload anything, if you cap your upload speed to 0.1kb/s you will effectively upload nothing and will in most cases upload nothing as other potential peers’ clients will get it from elsewhere instead of you because there wont be enough speed for you to make a difference

[quote=“inertia, post:21, topic:316101”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=412677.msg3052836#msg3052836 date=1260217462]

i guess Canadians (such as me) are safe, for now. cause downloading copyrighted materials is legal here but not uploading.

So torrents are illegal, doesn’t sound that safe to me.

Apparently only if you seed them.
[/quote]

So it’s legal to upload while you download?[/quote]
no because uploading the torrent,even as a peer, is still seeding, however i’d imagine the law just says no uploading which would constitute as being in the peer swarm

Read full topic
